citeinfo.title: Montana Major Lakes
citeinfo.othercit: The former name of the data set on the NRIS web site was "hd43"

descript.abstract:
This layer contains lakes and wide streams selected from 1:100,000 scale US Census Bureau TIGER files. The featues were selected to approximately match data shown in USGS 1:2,000,000 scale DLG files.
In this layer, polygons may represent lakes or wide streams. These layers are intended for cartographic representation of lakes and streams rather than geographic analyses.
Feature names are mostly from the TIGER files. Some were obtained from from Montana DOT county maps and USGS topographic maps.

browse.browsed: Thumbnail of Montana Lakes and Streams map

dataqual.complete: This is an arbitrary selection of lakes from the TIGER data.

horizpa.horizpar: Approximately 50 meters, assuming the source maps meet National Map Accuracy Standards

srcinfo.srccontr: The features in the layers were selected from this data set. This data set provided most of the stream and lake names.

procstep.procdesc: Convert TIGER files to Arc/Info format and project them from Geographic coordinates to Albers. Performed at the Billings office of GeoResearch (406-248-6771).
Select major streams and lakes from the TIGER data. This was performed between 10/1/92 and 7/23/93.
Parrot Lake was incorrectly named Ester Lake. Corrected the name of Parrot Lake and added Ester Lake from TIGER data.

attr.attrdef: area of the polygon in square meters
perimeter of the polygon in meters
Sequence number from original coverage version of the data
ID number from original coverage version of the data
Area of lake or river in acres

Feature Size classification
Classification may depend on the size of a stream that flows through a lake rather than just the size of the lake.
Flag for selecting polygons to label

edom.edomvd: Lable this feature. This seems to apply to all lakes.
Do not label this feature. This seems to apply to all streams.
